messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] sharing a release
messages.messageBody:
<<<<<<, but I wouldn't sell (or give!) someone my kid's spot in a school I
really thought was harmful. <<<<<

I feel the same way.

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] sharing a release
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/12/03 6:43:50 PM, qpwithcheese@hotmail.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/12/03 6:43:50 PM, qpwithcheese@... writes:

<< I'm trashing the all the old curricula and crap we have and my 9yo says
"Can
I scratch up my cd's?"
(alpha omega 4th grade cd's). Poor thing hated them. So, she's out there
now stomping on them joyfully. Feels so good. >>

Sounds healing!!

I know some people recommend selling that stuff, but I wouldn't sell (or
give!) someone my kid's spot in a school I really thought was harmful. So
why give them a school-at-home seat that used to have my kid's name on it?

I've thrown books away that I could have sold to a used bookstore because I
thought they had bad advice that would do more harm than good.

Sandra

messages.subject: sharing a release
messages.msgSnippet:
I m trashing the all the old curricula and crap we have and my 9yo says Can
I scratch up my cd s? (alpha omega 4th grade cd s).  Poor thing hated them.  So,
messages.messageBody:
I'm trashing the all the old curricula and crap we have and my 9yo says "Can
I scratch up my cd's?"
(alpha omega 4th grade cd's). Poor thing hated them. So, she's out there
now stomping on them joyfully. Feels so good.
tammy t.
